subject: RE: [junit] Re: Error while using junit.swingui.TestRunner - ( Server - WebLogic )
msgSnippet: What Anand is saying is that the client tests were done on Win2k and the server tests on a unix box. I suggest using the text runner always as it s much faster
messageBody:
What Anand is saying is that the client tests were done on Win2k and the
server tests on a unix box.

I suggest using the text runner always as it's much faster than the
swingui (at startup) and there are no classloader problems. Try using
VNC if you want to run swing in X11 and haven't got a windows X client.
It's pretty good.

-----Original Message-----
From: Robert Sartin [mailto:sartin@...]
Sent: 10 August 2001 16:55
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Re: Error while using junit.swingui.TestRunner - (
Server - WebLogic )



--- anand_73@... wrote:
> Could you elaborate on that ?
> I tried on my client machine and it works and I use Windows 2000 if
> that is of any significance

How odd, your errors indicate that Java wants to be using X11. Perhaps
your JDK is misconfigured. Do other Java GUIs work?

Regards,

Rob
